page.title: 01WIDNES 1985
page.content: { WIDNES}has been famous for many years for it's{Chemical Industry}so much so that it's{Rugby Football Team}is known as the{"Chemics".}In order to preserve it's history a{Chemical Museum}was opened in the Old Town Hall in{1982. In{1985 Patrick Jenkins,Minister}for the{Environment}handed over the key to Gossages Tower so that the museum may eventually be housed there.{Gossages {Tower}is famous as the former offices of the{soap}company on{Spike Island. } The{Ranger Service}are working hard to make Spike Island a place where people can enjoy their leisure.In a survey people thought that Widnes lacked Leisure Amenities and good shops such as Marks & Spencers,badly needed the long awaited Easterly By-Pass,feared an accident involving dangerous chemicalsand felt that more "beat bobbies" would help cut crime.
